Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveler147
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviewers I would say this Westin is the best hotel in the Phoenix area. I stayed for 5 days to visit friends and just relax. I was very pleased with the central location. My guest room was extremely spacious and well kept and it looked like the ones posted on their site. The hotel's common areas were clean and had that brand new feel. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Worth a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, clean, very modern, great location.”
Reviews.Author: 14Roger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I only stayed for one night but we found the hotel to excel in all aspects. The hotel has a great location, very nice and modern/clean cut atmosphere throughout the hotel and in the rooms. The room was very spacious and had a great view of downtown Phoenix. The hotel offered free boarding pass printing in the business center. There was otherwise a cost to use the computers. The only wish they offered a self parking option for vehicles. They only offered valet at $27 per day. In many cases despite calling down 5-10 min in advance our vehicle was not ready when we came down. I think the valet were often overwhelmed with the volume. Overall I would definitely return to this hotel. Probably the nicest in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line in every way”
Reviews.Author: kpoconnor
Reviews.Content: I am Platinum SPG member and stayed for one night on business. Had an early flight next morning so thought I would stay near airport. It was only about 10 min drive in the morning to airport. Some good things and some great things about this place. Was upgraded to one bedroom corner suite. WOW, what a nice room. Very clean and very BIG!. The bed was as you would expect from Westin (excellent). Shower had rain head and wall mount. There was also a large free standing tub! TV had large selection of Hidef channels. Internet was fast and free for Platinum members. There was a lounge but selection was so so. You do have to pay to park and there is NO shuttle to airport but still worth the stay. I would say this is one of the nicest non resort rooms I have ever had. The staff were all very friendly. I can not think of anything that could have been better about the room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Westin”
Reviews.Author: donhuns
Reviews.Content: Everything was appointed absolutely perfectly, as one would expect at a Westin. Very close to ASU downtown. The bookstore was a block away (...I'm still mad at myself that I didn't get an ASU tee...) This was our first trip to Phoenix, so we walked to Chase field for a day game in order to check out downtown (which is landscaped beautifully!) but the streetcar/tram stops directly across the street and we could have ridden that also. We both noticed the nice soft water in the shower. Not sure if this is a trait of the Phoenix water system or just the hotel, but it was softer than our water at home even with a water softener in place. (Not something that we usually mention, but it was very noticeable!) One negative was that the room was fairly dark. The room was decorated using darker tones, and it seemed that we needed a little additional light to make it right. There was plenty of light in the bathroom/vanity area however. The flatscreen TV was huge, so maybe the lighting was done to optimize viewing of the screen...? The restaurant was wonderful. We only had breakfast there, but both service and food were perfectly done. In short, we loved our stay at the downtown Westin and wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms with gorgeous views”
Reviews.Author: KatiMouse
Reviews.Content: Amazingly large rooms with floor to ceiling windows to show-off the city lights! The soaking tub in the suites it THE BEST I've come across, and the showers are quite large with the rainfall effect. Great food in the Concierge Lounge. Fabulous fitness center with a panoramic view ot the north. Very friendly staff, and excellent, slightly pricey restaurant. The only downfall is that there is no spa/Jacuzzi in the pool area. Despite this, it's one of my favorite hotels because of the beautiful views and fabulous soaking tub!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay at Westin Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: djoac
Reviews.Content: One of the largest hotel rooms I've ever seen and certainly the largest shower - you could almost fit a small car in there. Every thing was tastefully decorated and the staff was friendly and helpful. We ate at the restaurant a couple of times and the food was very good although pricey. The fitness center was amazing with panoramic views of the city. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel if you're not on a budget. Parking is across the street and the surrounding area appeared to be safe and well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!....”
Reviews.Author: NCPirate82
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms for a family of 4. The rooms were large, well-furnished and clean. The bathrooms were large as well. It's a very quite hotel. The location is outstanding with many restaurants nearby. The US Airways Center and Chase Field are only a few blocks away. The light rail stops right beside the hotel and it's a pretty quick trip to and from the airport. (I had to go back to the airport to pick up a rental car. We took a cab from the airport when we came in. I made it as quick on the light rail as the cab and it cost $1.75 as opposed to $30.) The hotel is very quiet and peaceful. The lobby is on the first floor and the next 10 are not part of the hotel. The meeting rooms and gym start on the 11th floor and the hotel rooms start on the 12th or 13th floor. The pool is pleasant (only 3 1/2 feet deep.) Our rooms had a small (empty) refrigerator which was convenient for us. I guess they all have them. Bottled water was free in the rooms as well as the gym. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked appealing. We did go to the bar and the service there was excellent. Parking is $27 a night but there is a nice, well-lit parking garage literally right across the street (between the Westin and the Hyatt) which charges $12 for a 24 hour period. The only complaints I have about the room (and they are very minor) is that the lighting is not good at night when looking for something in the closet and the alarm clock rather difficult to figure out. The staff is very friendly and helpful. This is an excellent hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Brightpath4
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here! If you can afford it, it is totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: SirTravelALot12
Reviews.Content: I really could not reccomend this place anymore thanI already do. It is a great hotel, great views, great service, very clean and modern rooms and most of all a comfortable clean bed. We had a corner studio suite on the 17th or 18th floor. It was great, I love the glass from floor to ceiling. At $450/night it is a little pricey but much better than the other hotels I have stayed at downtown that are similarly priced. I don't know how anyone could not like this hotel. We had breakfast vouchers with our room, I didn't like what they were serving for the voucher breakfast so I orderd eggs benedict and low and behold they didn't charge us for it and accepted the voucher no questions asked. Most hotels nickle and dime you wherever they can but I think this is one of the top 5 hotels I have stayed at. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: terere2
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and book this hotel if you are going to downtown Phoenix. This is the best Westin that I have ever stayed in and I have been to many. I was fortunate to be placed in an 18th floor corner room with a freestanding tub and a multitude of windows. The room was huge, well-designed and featured a very comfortable bed. Aaron did a wonderful job greeting me and the lounge staff was very friendly. The food was tasty and included cookies/snacks made by the property's pastry chef. Great fitness center and the location is superb. I took the light rail in from the airport and the station/stop is literally across the street from the lobby. Check out Matt's Big Breakfast a few blocks north.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anon Y
Reviews.Content: This Westin was nice in that the rooms were very clean (even for Westin standards), modern looking, and quite large. It really felt like the hotel had been built or renovated recently. It was also nice that the hotel's business center and gym were open 24 hours. Room service was great too. Several things to note about this hotel. The hotel looks to be a part of a business building (I think the first 10 or so floors are business offices?). Also, not sure but this building may have been a complete office building before the top floors were converted to hotel rooms--each floor has a name that looks as if you are walking into a doctor's office. Also, one of the other downsides while I was visiting was that the pool had been rented out to a private party. Understandable that the hotel needs to make money, but it seems pretty presumptuous to close the pool on the weekend when that is one of the top amenities at the hotel. It wasn't a deal breaker for me, but I could see that a visiting family might be annoyed. Last but not least, the AC unit in the room does not seem to be adjustable. You can control the temperature range to a degree, but the unit appears to be permanently on. This was annoying if you didn't want the fan blowing on you all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique style hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mainegirl759
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some of the nicest guest rooms I have ever stayed in. Great staff. My bag was destined to be an overweight after a pleasure/business trip and they came to my room, packed up some of my belongings and shipped them home for me at about 20% of what the airline told me would be the cost of an overweight bag! Great service! And the restof the staff were equally as helpful and nice. I was traveling on business alone, and this is a nice, quiet hotel and a great place for a woman alone - nice bar where you can eat dinner. I would stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, awesome room”
Reviews.Author: DavidBradley
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 18th floor and had beautiful views of Phoenix. Floor to ceiling windows and very high ceilings make the over- size rooms feel even larger. Typical Westin sleek decor, with great attention to detail. We did not have a corner room, but the bathroom was quite large. iPod and IPad interface allows you to play video through the television or music through ( good) sound system. The exercise facility was much better than average, with multiple ellipiticals, bikes and treadmills, and five weight machines. The pool is quite small, and there is no hot tub which is a bummer because the patio setting of the pool is very nice. Service was absolutely excellent. We didn't eat at the restaurant but it looked very nice. As others have said the Metro rail is literally across the street from the hotel entrance, and there is service on this light rail from the airport. This Westin is a no- brainier for business in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: Wonderful and professional welcome from the staff. We had to wait a few minutes while our room was being quality checked for availability. The specialist, provided us cold bottled water and a very comfortable place to wait. We were upgraded to a corner room, which was gorgeous. Wet bar. Separate seating area. Floor to ceiling windows, and a extremely spacious bath with a huge tub and huge separate shower. The shower had two separate shower heads. One adjustable and one that was an overhead rain shower. Double sinks. Fluffy robes were also waiting for us. Bath amenities includes the standard "white tea" (which is my only negative. Not my favorite). I forgot to mention the obvious..the heavenly bed and top notch linens...which are always heavenly. We had access to the club lounge which needs to be established as the club lounge that all Starwood properties should mimic. Provided was a light breakfast on the weekend and a full breakfast during the weekdays. Snacks, evening appetizers, and evening dessert is also available. What makes this club lounge so commendable is the staff. Kelvin, Matt, Athena, just to name a few provided the best service I have ever received at a Westin. (I have stayed at many). We arrived late one night an desserts had been put away, so a delicious hot cookie was delivered to our room. So unexpected but greatly appreciated. Location: easy access to freeways, several restaurants within walking distance. Room: Clean, comfortable and quiet Parking: Valet only. No Self Park a bit spendy at $27/night TIP: you can park on the street (we did) during the weekends and evenings at no charge. Just be sure either leave or put money in the meter by 8AM. Meters in force 8AM to 8PM Mon-Fri. Will we be back? Looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Best business hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ActiveTraveler1
Reviews.Content: To my knowledge, this hotel did not start as a hotel and that may be what makes it distinctive. The people, however, make it terrific. Originally, I think the building was supposed to be part of an office building. However, due to the changing commercial real estate market, it was decided to make the floors 11-18 into hotel and meeting rooms (I think the first 10 floors are the parking garage). Floors above 18 are predominantly used by the tenant whose name is on the top of the building, Freeport-McMoran. What this means for the traveler is that the rooms are huge, even by most luxury hotel standards. Add in the fact that it is still relatively new and you've got a physical plant that is both unique, inviting and comfortable (e.g. the Heavenly Bed). Not all rooms have tubs, so if this is important, you might double check with the hotel. However, the bathroom appointments are neat, clean and modern. Internet connection is excellent. Without exception, everyone I have met at this hotel (I have stayed about half dozen times) is friendly and truly seems to want to help make your stay a pleasant one. If you are able to get upgraded to the Westin Club Lounge (not all Westins have this feature), I would highly recommend it. Both Athena and Shaina are terrific hosts, not only knowledgeable about the area and the hotel, but focused on making sure you are comfortable using the Lounge. One final tip: Downtown Phoenix is about a 15 minute drive to the airport, so you can also use this hotel as an 'airport hotel' for those late night arrivals/early morning departures (PHX has no hotel on the premises). One thing to look out for: The hotel is literally in the middle of downtown Phoenix, so you might want to time your arrival so that it does not conflict with rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cool...”
Reviews.Author: acandkc
Reviews.Content: Get a room on the 18th floor.....the rooms are huge, the views magnificent. The rooms seem cool temperature wise...not a bad thing in Phoenix! They are decorated with hardwood floors, gray walls, and ceiling to floor windows. The beds are comfy and the bathroom amenities are great. The little fridge even has a temperature control. The elevators are fast...and the front desk helpful. I think the drinks were pricy, but the little courtyard with the firepit is inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: orchid6510
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference in the convention center in November. The rooms are very nice and really large with modern amenities (ipod docks for the alarm clock and TV) and contemporary decor. The heavenly bed was of course heavenly! I had a great view of the mountains surrounding the city from my room. I got room service the first night I was there and the gourmet sandwich and salad I got were delicious. The hotel is a short walk (about 10 min.) to the convention center and to the Arizona center which has several good restaurants and a Starbucks (not very good shopping though). I liked the short walk in the morning; however, if you're the type of person who likes to walk out the front door and have everything right there you might want to choose a different hotel. The location of the hotel was the only semi-negative for me. As I mentioned before, it is only a short walk, but you walk past a parking garage on one side and what looked like an empty run-down building on the other side on your way to the convention center & Arizona Center. I did see a couple of homeless people on that path, but this is a city, and they were not bothering anyone, so that didn't really bother me. During the day this was fine, but at night, as I was a women travelling alone and most of my colleagues stayed at one of the larger hotels directly across from the convention center, it did make me a little nervous to walk back to the hotel, but I just walked fast and stayed aware of my surroundings. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for the clean, nice, comfortable, modern rooms, and nice staff, but especially if you are a woman travelling alone, just be aware that the location is slightly away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix for a biz trip to the central city area. I was not looking forward to it. I arrived at The Westin and was overwhelmed. I was very early and check in was actually a pleasure b/c the staff was so kind. I solicited their opinion on the bus/tram station across the street for a little adventure. Off I went on public transport for a hike up Camelback -- the meetings did not start till the next day. So they are well situated next to public transport, which you won't likely use, but I did. The hotel was fantastic. In fact it was so good that I am now looking for other Westin/Starwood properties as I travel. I don't think they could have improved on anything. The room was new and HUGE. Bath was fantastic. Staff overly kind but genuine. The restaurant was excellent (I can't remember the name). I had salmon. Fitness center was spotless. If I go back to Phoenix this is where I want to stay. Thank you all for a wonderful 2 nights that I was not looking forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Calm, and Modern- A great fit for the tired tourist.”
Reviews.Author: BSelishev
Reviews.Content: Set in the heart of Phoenix's business center and minutes by foot from the cultural underworld The Westin Phoenix is a can't miss hotel opportunity. Inside you will find a strange type of serenity compared to the hustle and bustle of the lively outside atmosphere. On your way in there is a helpful front desk, beautiful corridors, and sleek hallways. Inside your room you can expect high ceilings plush bedding, stunning views and an avant-garde interior. The Westin Phoenix is a best bet, buy, and stay. I recommend it highly and add that it might be one of the best SPG/Westin hotels in the world, placing itself next to New York, Las Vegas, Rome, London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Westin”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: One of the better Westin properties I have stayed at. Spacious rooms, great amenities and the rates were crazy cheap when I was in town. Even with business out in Scottsdale it was well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Quality Starwood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMH18
Reviews.Content: Lovely new(er) hotel located three blocks away from convention center. Superb staff, comfortable rooms, lovely facility. A positive experience from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: Lynne M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel New Years Eve and the hotel was wonderful. From the time we checked in to the time we left everything was perfect. Everyone, and I mean everyone, working at the hotel made us feel very special. The room was great! We had the Studio King room and it was modern contemporary. Very nice! And the view, wow. The bathroom had two full walls of windows and the long wall of the bedroom was all windows. We had a few drinks and appetizers at the small bar/lounge in the hotel before going out for the evening and it was very nice; then, the next morning, ate breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel and really enjoyed the food. We will definitely stay at this hote again. I recommend The Westin Phoenix Downtown to anyone wanting to stay in downtown Phoenix, weather a Business traveler or for pleasure,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: oskiwow
Reviews.Content: This property is an excellent break from the typical business hotel. The rooms are huge and very up to date--even luxurious. The bathroom is modern and spacious. The gym is first rate and service was excellent. Location is just a two minute walk to the Maricopa County Court House so it is very convenient for court appearances. There may be more resort-like places to stay in Phoenix with golf and outdoorsy attractions, but if you're all business and need to stay downtown, this is my first bet. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! One of the nicest Westins I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly new, and I was given and upgrade as I am a SPG platinum. I loved this hotel! I had a jr suite which was thoughtfully laid out with a full wall of windows overlooking the city - amazing view. The room was huge with sitting area and a large tub and enormous shower. All the Westin service (I used valet and room service) were friendly and timely. And, i used the Fitness center facilities which were good. Will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service / Excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: bskyz
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this Westin while in town to run the Phoenix marathon in Jan '12, and my wife and I were quite impressed. The entire hotel appears to be recently remodeled, and the guest rooms were the most spacious and best laid out of any Westin we have stayed at. Great views from most rooms as the hotel starts on the 11th floor, and the location was perfect for us as it was just three blocks from the expo and marathon start. Staff was very helpful in locating restaurants as well. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Phoenix the Next Generation of Starwood Excellence”
Reviews.Author: frequentstaydude
Reviews.Content: I came to Phoenix this past December to see friends before the Christmas Holiday. Phoenix has typically had a number of tired old convention hotels and limited service properties Enter the Westin a game changer in a slowly revitalizing Downtown. To disagree with some other posters it’s not your typical Westin its far better! It is a class act upscale hotel with unique design details that shows Westin can still be a head turner and leader in hospitality in an all too often cost cutting world. Upon check in ...... I was welcomed with genuine appreciation as a 12 year Platinum elite member of Starwood Preferred Guest. The young team was filled with passion & smiles. They appeared to be genuinely interested in me and the quality and experience of my stay. Why has this become so hard to accomplish in so many other properties I stay at? Was upgraded to a beautiful luxurious and comfortable suite. The bathroom was wonderful and almost every important luxury touch was there. It is great to see Westin continue to blaze new trails after some other lack luster Westins started cropping up in recent years here in North America Heres one thats far from cookie cutter. The majority of the team worked well together and jumped to make any request happen When they didn’t their inspired team support had someone immediately picking up on the one failure that occurred. I admire any hotel that quickly recovers comes up with a solution and makes sure the guest is fully satisfied.Caring as if they mean it........... The value was so strong for what I paid here the next few hotels couldn’t measure up. If I were Starwood this is the brand standard I would aspire to in every location. The expected and not so expected included........ • Complimentary access as a Platinum frequent stay member to their modern Executive Club lounge with a nice breakfast spread, delicious fresh fruit in season including scrambled eggs and bacon. Hot dishes like eggs are frequently missing from most club lounges I visit. Freshly baked muffins,nice array of newspapers.All the basics are here If you don’t have top elite status pay for the club. It’s one of a handful of lounges that really is worth paying for access and you can get in and out when time matters. Only the evening spread was a yawn and not interesting. Not a big deal when you are about to hit the town for dinner anyway shorty after • The Legendary Heavenly bed and its nice linens. • A really good restaurant called Province that’s rising but not fully there yet. The talent is clearly there and I would be delighted to return Yes there were some misses on the menu and local reviews reflect that as well. However there were also some big hits. My stand out dish was the grilled salmon. Look at the seafood items here which appear to be standouts Beautiful fresh fish cooked very nicely. Delicious Brussel sprouts magnificently prepared and a lovely heartfelt team. Not all seasoned or polished but making the effort. • The health club was adequate and very attractive. Being more serious about my fitness routine I paid to use Gold’s Gym nearby as like most hotel health clubs it just misses the mark with the fitness equipment options unless you after primarily cardio equipment which it has all the basics required. I have moved to Hyatt and other brands in recent years as Starwood and its program has been in some sort of minor decline. Some of their hotels lost appreciation and recognition of its frequent customers. This is a hotel where there is no penny pinching team members are happy to be there and guest are enjoying their stay and being productive Elite members are cared for as is all guests. How good is the Westin Phoenix? I recently stayed at a Starwood luxury collection hotel at 4 x the price and it was inferior in every way. The Westin Phoenix ranks amongst my best hotel stays of 2011 out of 200 plus nights on the year on the road. The only thing I dislike about the hotel is the horrible floral stinky putrid scent in the lobby that Starwood and select other hotel companies pump through their ventilation systems. Some obviously like it. Unfortunately this is Starwood corporate decision to perfume their hotel lobbies so I do not fault the hotel in anyway. Thankfully it is odor free in hallways and the hotels well kept state of the art guest rooms. None the less I thank the management and team of this hotel for a great stay helping me to remember why I like Starwood Hotels and the SPG program all over again. You are my new go to hotel anytime in Phoenix My congratulations to Starwood and SPG they got this one right!!! The Westin Phoenix delivers on the brand promise.Hopefully that never changes More Westins like this Starwood!

Reviews.Title: “Westin for New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: AnnaAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin New Year’s Eve as it was within walking distance to the Orpheum Theater where we were attending a concert. The hotel is new and is located within a building that is shared with corporate offices unassociated with the Westin. When we arrived it initially took a few moments to realize that the valet parking turn in was on the west side of the building and not at the south facing entrance. Once we found the turn-in the valet staff was very pleasant and helpful to instruct us how to reach the lobby. A note, the hotel is valet only, no self parking unless you park off-site. The check-in was smooth and the young brunette woman (wish I could remember her name) was most pleasant and helpful. She asked if we needed dinner arrangements and offered to assist with reservations or suggestions. Once she found that we were attending the concert she offered directions or any other additional information. The room was much nicer and larger than we had anticipated. The floor-to-ceiling windows were stunning and we enjoyed the view watching the sunset. The extended ceiling height also adds greatly to the room along with a well appointed bathroom and terrific shower. There was enough room for both of us to move around and get ready for the evening without a problem with an extremely comfortable bed, additional seating area and ample work desk. A quick call to guest services and we received additional pillows within minutes. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant however we did order room service for breakfast which was tasty and delivered promptly and professionally. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful and we would not hesitate to stay at the Westin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: fivefromco
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a friendly front desk staff and each person was quick to answer every question we had about the surrounding area. There is nothing to complain about with the service. The room we had was very nice; though could used (or perhaps I should have requested) some foam pillows -- every pillow in the room was very soft. The hotel is within walking distance to the convention center, baseball stadium, basketball stadium and a host of restaurants. Best part: there is a light rail stop right across the street. I'd stay here again the next time I am in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience - excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Veronica Q
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great hotel! We have stayed here a few times now and we absolutely love it! The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous and modern. The bathrooms are enormous. You feel very relaxed in the rooms. The food is great (we always splurge and order room service) always on time and very tasty. The main reason we love (even more so now) this hotel is for its customer service, they go beyond and above customer service expectations. We had booked a reservation for New Years Eve, but turns out I booked it for the wrong date. Long story short: the desk manager Brandon Daniels was excellent! He helped us deal with Expedia's awful customer support for about 45 minutes. He was very knowledgeable and didn't get frustrated with the situation (despite being on hold for so long on a busy night). The rest of the staff was above and beyond as well - they always greet you and always ask if they can help with anything. Overall - the reason we keep coming back to the Westin Phoenix Downtown is for its excellent customer. I'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury At the Westin Phoenix Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Bigmac56
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to spend a special evening at the Westin Downtown Phoenix. Excellent location right in downtown, the Westin is a converted office building with beautiful,spacious rooms. The rooms have floor to ceiling glass which offers an outstanding panoramic view of the valley of the sun. The decor of the hotel was modern, clean and chic. The workout facility had state of the art equipment and also great views of Camelback mountain as you worked out. The bar was great with friendly bartenders. By far the best feature of this hotel was the staff. They were friendly, professional, competent and really made us feel like they wanted to do whatever was necessary to ensure we had a perfect visit, which we did. .

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Path / Typical Westin Quality”
Reviews.Author: goferhockey
Reviews.Content: Anyone familiar with downtown Phoenix knows it isn't the most happening place. Granted, I was there at the end of July, but even during the middle of the week there was hardly a soul out and about during the lunch hour. This Westin is on the outer edge of that limited downtown vibe. The hotel is nice, typical Westin quality. The layout is a tad funky. You need to walk through the lobby and the restaurant entrance to get to the outdoor pool area. The main entrance is a good distance from the elevators. There is no convenience store or gift shop to buy small toiletries or beverages and the nearest such store (a CVS, I believe) is a several block walk. But, the hotel is right on the light rail so it makes travelling too and from the airport convenient. A good place for people travelling on business to the downtown area or even if you are in town for a sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Small lobby, but very nice. Consistent with Westin.”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumBeast
Reviews.Content: Lobby is not as big as the very attractive lobby at the Sheraton a couple blocks away, but the elegance, smell and music just make you feel good. The rooms are beautiful. I got a corner suite and having the tub on the corner overlooking downtown was a huge plus. Only thing disappointing was that they give you a luxurious tub and view, but when I called room service for bath bubbles and salt, they didn't have any, nor did they offer suggestions. I ended up calling back and having to ask for additional body wash to create bubbles. Another downside is that there is no self-park available so you either pay $27 valet or park at the Phx Downtown metered parking which is only free from 8pm-8am. Other than that, the consistency in level of service, the staff, and cleanliness are a plus. Club lounge is nice too. They don't offer full breakfast and dinner, but the little they serve is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in a long time! Newly remodeled and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: tuckdaddy04
Reviews.Content: This is an extremely nice hotel. The rooms are large and very comfortable with a great view of the city and local mountains. The Westin Workout facility has very nice equipment and they always have complimentary bottled waters and towels available. If you forget your headphones, they have complimentary sets for you to use. Nice big bathrooms with walk in showers. I definitely recommend. Who knows, maybe I'll become a Starwood guy.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MMkoppel
Reviews.Content: After four days on the road, we were ready for a comfortable stay in Phoenix, so we checked in to the Westin Phoenix Downtown. With floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city, this is a stunning facility. We were only there for one night, and were sorry about that. Room service was outstanding, and breakfast in the morning provided the perfect send off for the end of our journey across country. The four of us on the trip will long remember the excellent service we received from staff, and the excellent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Westin does it right”
Reviews.Author: SpecialKNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Phoenix downtown for a convention I was attending. The main hotel was the Sheraton but the Westin is a quick 2 block walk. From the minute I arrived, I felt a different vibe compared to other Westins I have stayed at. This has a small hotel feel and every single staff member talks to you! The rooms are huge and the Heavenly bed is super comfy. Plenty of space for hanging clothes, small fridge, couch, etc. As a Platnium member, I had access to the club lounge which is open 7 days a week. They offer a light breakfast and hot options at 5pm. I ate in the restaurant for lunch and dinner. Make sure you eat outside with the firepit and get the Hawaiian tuna. I loved this hotel and am so happy that it is downtown. Starwood, you did good!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like an office building (a nice one)”
Reviews.Author: ncinaz
Reviews.Content: While the rooms at this new-ish hotel are lovely and ultra-modern, the overall impression of the hotel is cold and depressing. Halls are dark and gray. While the lobby and public spaces are modern and attractive you would have absolutely no clue you are in Arizona based on the design of the hotel. You might as well be in St. Louis given how few nods there are to the desert. Don't bother paying to be on a "club floor." It turns out they're almost all club floors and the food offerings are laughable (cold cereal in the morning, no desserts in the evening). The thermostat in the room was a complete mystery. It did what it wanted to do with little regard for what temperature I set it to.

Reviews.Title: “Tried hard no bananas”
Reviews.Author: Suhana018
Reviews.Content: I found a the hotel to have a lot of sweet meaning indians not enough chiefs. Could not find any evidence of room service in the room. Wifi was an additional annoying fee, valet was $27 Would not dream of staying there again Scottsdales a zillion times classier and better. I guess this s a place you stay for pure business if you have that downtown Phoenix. Incidentally, the local transport of bicycle riders was superb

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Phoenix Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Peggy H
Reviews.Content: Unusually spacious rooms w/floor-to-ceiling windows; glass-enclosed shower with square shower head, resulting in a rain forest experience; safe, fridge, coffee maker; hangars that can be removed without wrestling; high thread-count linens and thirsty towels; solid doors to ensure quiet; delivery of USA Today on weekdays; friendly, efficient housekeepers; lovely small infinity pool with comfortable seating; light rail station across the street; close to theaters and symphony hall; and outstandingly accommodating front desk staff. I stay in hotels 4 or 5 times a year, and this is the best hotel I have ever encountered. I'd visit Phoenix again, but only if I could stay at the Westin Phoenix Downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Service Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cory W
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a business trip to Phoenix, where my party of 50 people stayed at the Westin downtown. From the very first contact to our last goodbyes, we found the Westin staff to be extraordinary. Their service was amazing for our diverse group with many special needs and changes. Not only that but the space was beautiful as well. The rooms are large and spacious with floor to ceiling windows. The public spaces are filled with art and decorated in a comfortable contemporary style. The location is convenient to Arizona state and downtown and opposite a light rail stop. There were several nice areas within easy walking distance to eat and shop nearby, the beautiful downtown campus of Arizona State and a quick light rail away from some great museums. Speaking of dining, the hotel restaurant was a culinary delight, in fact many of us ate there every evening. The outdoor courtyard with it's fountains and fire pits is not to be missed. An exceptional experience. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in downtown Phoenix.”
Reviews.Author: Bayturtle
Reviews.Content: Our expectations were low, so we were pleasantly surprised by this chic new (opened spring 2011) Westin in downtown Phoenix. It's more "W" than Westin. Decor is modern, Asian-inspired and minimalist. Rooms are huge. The spaces were great to be in especially the restaurant, which had a GREAT menu and good food and prices, but needs help in perfecting the implementation to achieve consistency. Feedback-- (1) Westin needs a COTTON blanket option. Down is too hot for Phoenix and, I, for one, am allergic to it. I want a washable COTTON blanket option. (2) The mattress was uncomfortably hard for me. The pillow top was quite sparse and I needed more cushioning. Otherwise, great hotel and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: inezsson
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very nice and the staff extremely accommodating. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable. It is also in a great location. There are many restaurants, shops and places of interest within 2 blocks in any direction. The light rail system is located across the street and is very easy to use. It will take you to malls, restaurants and the airport. The restaurant in the hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “I could get used to living this way”
Reviews.Author: ranger505
Reviews.Content: The Westin Phoenix Downtown is unique in its HUGE room size. The hotel was less than a year old when I made my visit. The building was originally designed for office space---- which I guess the developers were not able to occupy. There is a lobbly level and the spacious, well appointed rooms are on floors 11-18. The staff is ultra-attentive and helpful. This is my first visit to a Westin property, so this may be well known information already. Staff removed all of the down bedding for me and replaced with fiber fill. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, elegant”
Reviews.Author: Mjsomaha
Reviews.Content: The Westin downtown Phoenix is ba beautiful property, elegantly designed with hospitable staff and very, very spacious rooms. The bed is the kind you never want to leave. Rooms are on the upper floors 11 to 18, so they are very quiet. Wifi is pricey at $15 per day, and I find that annoying but it also seems to be the standard in higher end hotels, which I find odd. Nevertheless, I would certainly recommend it to anyone attending a conference in Phoenix or looking for a weekend retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the new standard for Westin hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Marky London
Reviews.Content: I have to echo all the positive comments below - this hotel is exceptional for a Westin. Excellent service from arrival to departure, where every associate we came across genuinely seemed to care and came across in warm and friendly way. Great recognition as a frequent Starwood guest with an upgrade to a superb corner studio suite - it had fantastic bathroom with a view. Nice Club lounge and well equipped gym. Had dinner in the hotel on the patio which was very good with attentive service andinteresting food. This is way above any other city Westin I have stayed in the US and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jedavan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the Phoenix Conference Center and what a great choice. The front counter staff were excellent, rooms spotless and overall experience excellent. Hands down one of the best hotels I've stayed at ... I can't recommend it enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel for business traveler, not a resort for the vacationer”
Reviews.Author: jg56
Reviews.Content: spacious, modern rooms. everything well thought out. typical Westin beds and bath. very clean. staff friendly and seemingly there to please. location was fine for my work but a little down on the heels after dark. pool is small but fine for an urban location. did not eat at the hotel. this hotel has everything one needs if staying in PHX for business. definitely not a resort feel and not a hotel i would recommend for vacationing - either as a couple and certainly not for a family. will definitely return should i need a downtown phoenix hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great for the downtown traveler”
Reviews.Author: WWPaci
Reviews.Content: Downtown is really hit or miss for activities or ambiance. One street is new and nice and the next is skid row. Keep that in mind before judging the hotel. I am a native Phoenician and this hotel and its location are great . Beautiful, crisp, modern rooms. Every staff member was super helpful. It is next to the Light Rail, close to major stadiums for sporting events and concerts, and near a new up and coming arts scene. Great downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful property, amazing associate”
Reviews.Author: JoEllen M
Reviews.Content: Amanda at the front desk started my stay with exceptional customer service. She turned what could have been a terrible hotel stay into a great experience. We were too late to book rooms at the conference hotels and booked a stay at a downtown hotel that was less than acceptable. Amanda worked with me to get a room for four nights. Amanda was helpful in every way. I am so glad she was on duty that night. I must comment though that everyone we had interactions with at the hotel went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and courteous, always willing to go the extra mile for a guest. The room was truly beautiful, wonderful ammenities - check out the rain forest shower! The hotel is quite clean and the view from the spacious windows is lovely. The food in the hotel dining room is very good. The service in the dining room is a bit spotty and sometimes there is a wait for food, drinks or checks. This would not stop me from staying at this Westin again. The total experience was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: nick9itfc
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in the downtown area with lovely large rooms that will not disappoint. The gym is good although could do with separate changing area and the bar is reasonable but way too small. I wish there was better wifi service too - does it really need to be $12.95 a day in room or $6.95 for 15 mninutes in the business center? The main reason for this review though is to praise the incredibly friendly and helpful staff - especially Amanda T who couldn't do enough to make the stay a good one - true 5 star service - thank you. Nick

Reviews.Title: “Great everything”
Reviews.Author: lwgaddes
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. I had a great view. The service and room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “New Phoenix Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Joski69
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood Gold members who frequent Westin and W properties. Booked a Saturday night using points for an anniversary staycation. Arrived to convenient valet service, ($27 per night) located just around the corner from the lobby. Clerk acknowledged our anniversary as it was noted on the reservation. Upgraded our room to a Deluxe King that had great views facing west. Turned out, we occupied one of 12 rooms that were booked that night. This hotel, due to location, caters more to business travelers during the week and sporting/concert events when taking place nearby. Perhaps the staff was a little bored but service was exemplary. Room is one of the largest I have seen at a Westin. Huge wardrobe in hallway entrance that houses hanging space, drawers and a mini bar that can be stocked to your liking or used for anything you bring. Large dresser with flat screen TV across from the bed. Large couch near window in addition to chair and ottoman next to the interior wall of the room. Also a nice desk/work space with a char on each side. Floor to ceiling windows compliment the great view west. Bathroom has a large shower stall, no tub, with both rain shower and hand held shower based on preference. One sink in large vanity and toiled area that is open to the rest. If you intend to share this room, a high level of in the bathroom should not be expected unless you close the main door to the room, which prevents someone from using any of it. Typical heavenly bed included. Room was absolutely spotless. Ordered room service for snacks and hotel was willing to add menu items from the independent restaurant on site. As a gesture for our anniversary, they brought us two small bottles of champagne, two ice cream bars, box of truffles and extra water and soft drinks at no charge. They forgot an item and retrieved it immediately with great apologies. Asked bellman about train schedule and they offered to arrange a town car for $14. Room service cart disappeared from hallway without calling to have it picked up. Hotel is freeway close, on the light rail line and close to stadiums and restaurants. Perfect location. Can not find anything I would change about our stay and this hotel will surely be our new property of choice when staying in downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding room, amenities, and service”
Reviews.Author: SkyLordHeuksa
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Phoenix area frequently for business but this was my first stay at the Westin. Where to begin?! The room was wonderfully appointed. It was large and comfortable. Everything from the pillows to the bathroom fixtutures were first rate. Even the climate controls worked perfectly. There was not one thing about my room that was sub par. My colleagues and I enjoyed an evening at the Province restaurant located in the lobby. What began as dinner before heading out ended with us spending the entire evening at Province. The food, desert menu, and service were outstanding. Such a friendly and comfortable environment! Finally, the front desk and concierge service were excellent. Oh yes, and the price was very reasonable as well. I plan to stay at this hotel every chance that I get.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: juthie
Reviews.Content: My stay at the downtown Phoenix Westin was very pleasant... the staff was very helpful, and the room was great, even had a wine cooler in it... The beds were soooo comfortable as were the many pillows on each bed... It was very conveniently located to many shops, restaurants and night life, plus the baseball stadium Chase Field was only a few blocks away.. awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Phoenix...Stylish and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Flyintl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Westin Downtown Phoenix on Aug 30. Hotel is only 6 months old and the facilities are great. The room (King corner) was very large, stylish and well-equipped. The fitness center/gym is decent sized and equipped with treadmills, ellipticals, recumbant bike, a small Lifefitness weight machine circuit and free weights up to 50 lbs. There's an outdoor pool (nice in the Arizona summer). Location is in center fo downtown and you can walk to all businesses from there. Hotel is only on floors 11-18 of the commercial building and the rooms are very bright,quiet and well-insulated from noise, have wired internet, in room safe and all the standard amenities of 4-start hotels.. Service was great and attentive. Executive lounge food and drink offerings are better than most lounges of the same caliber in the greater Phoenix area, so I would recomment the executive club lounge/floor at this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cstrom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean. I am a very picky person and I could not find one thing wrong with this place. The room was gorgeous and had an awesome view of Phoenix. I felt like a VIP. The staff at the fron desk was very nice and they took care of my bags for me while I went to a meeting (after I had checked out). Great place. I will be staying there again next time I go to Phoenix for business.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room... will stay here again (soon!)”
Reviews.Author: cmills
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful inside, comfortable and classy. We stayed here as a little get away following a concert downtown and we are already excited to go back. The shower alone is an event! Turn a little lever and it's raining! The room service was right on time and the food was spot on. Well done Westin... always a class act. Our only disappointment was the lack of free high speed internet. If we had stayed longer this would have been an issue but just an overnight was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: GoBears90
Reviews.Content: New look and feel. Seems like a conversion of an office to a hotel for several of the tower floors. Nice separation of those office and hotel elements. Great workout gym with good views and great equipment. Rooms are deep and feel spacious. Energy efficient gizmos in the rooms - make you feel green. Decent and adequately sized bar. If i was there on business, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels We Have Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: PTCFA
Reviews.Content: For our trip to Phoenix, AZ for our Biannual General Council, we stayed at the Phoenix Westin Downtown. It was probably the best hotel my family and I have stayed at. After much research of the Phoenix area, I discovered the Westin had opened and made reservations on their website and found an incredible deal. From the moment we drove up to the hotel to the time we left, we were treated like royalty. The service was impeccable. The guys at the valet parking had our car brought out front as soon as we needed it and always were helpful in giving directions to various places around the city. On the first day that we arrived the bellman that delivered our luggage to our room made us feel right at home. I believe his name was Ricardo. He shared all about the hotel as well as the amenities of our room. The rooms at the Westin are amazing. They are huge and have a great floor to ceiling window overlooking the city of Phoenix. One night we were able to see the fireworks from Chase Field. Another great experience at the hotel was the club level. We paid an additional $30 a day and was able to have breakfast, snacks during the day, different selections of of food in the early evening and desserts after 7 PM. Those that attended the club level were terrific. If you are going to Phoenix, AZ for any reason, be it business or vacation, you need to stay at this hotel. Take my word for it. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, spacious, minimalist chic accommodations in the heart of the valley.”
Reviews.Author: CheapUpgrade85
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze... Good service both outside and at reception. The rooms are more like studio apartments than hotel rooms. They feature beautiful hardwood floors, the best bed I've ever slept in, stunning views from floor to ceiling windows, a nice television and a gorgeous and highly functional bathroom complete with rain shower. Food in the restaurant Province was unique, well executed, and well prepared. The club lounge is a nice place to relax and rehydrate in the evening. While I may not have had immediate neighbors above me or on my floor, I have not stayed in a quieter hotel... Major bonus points for that. To say I thoroughly enjoyed it would be an understatement. Food

Reviews.Title: “Wow, needs better management”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior184
Reviews.Content: This was my secound try at this newly converted hotel. I checked in and was advised that because of my frequency status I had been upgraded. I had been careful to book a room with a full bath since I knew that most of their rooms only have 3/4 baths. My room description had said double vanity which I had had previously so I knew It was probably like my last room. The upgraded room only had a single vanity making me question the "upgrade". I ordered dinner and specifically asked for a cart not a tray, so I could sit and watch Television. The meal arrived on a tray but the very helpful attendant quickly corected that but when he removed the cover we realized it wasn't what I had ordered. I decided to forgo dinner. As I prepared for bed I tried to close the blackouts but they wouldn't come together. I called and a maintenance man was immediately sent and tried to repair the problem, but we both came to the conclusion that it waas not fixable as it was a design flaw. I thought I could live with it and decided to try to sleep through it. Unfortunaltey the ray of light split the bed right in half and caused a fitful night of sleep. On my way out at 6:45am the next morning I asked for an emailed copy of my bill which I was assured would be sent. A week later no bill had been received. I phoned and someone assured me they would send me a copy. Two more weeks went by and I sent a comment to SPG asking for a copy of the bill. I received a canned response assuring me I would receive a copy of the bill. A week after receiving thiis I copied and pasted the response in another comment asking again for a copy of the bill. Another canned response saying I would receive a copy. It has been a week and still no copy received from anyone. If this is how their top frequency guests are treated I don't hold out much hope for the rest of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is one of the nicest and friendliest”
Reviews.Author: travelsmuch
Reviews.Content: Was in town for the MLB Allstar Game week. This hotel was the only one in the downtown district that did not withhold their rooms from the general public. The Sheraton, Wyndham, and Hyatt all declared "no rooms available" as early as January 2011. Thank you Westin for having rooms at a normal price during the sellout week. The front desk employees were all very helpful, accommodating, and friendly. Everything in the room and public areas was very clean and attractive. I could not find one thing wrong with this stay. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: Maria44Tucson
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new hotel, with spacious cool new rooms, floor to ceiling windows, luxurious bathrooms, in room safes & refrigerators, centrally located next to everything downtown. Bar & restaurant had great food with happy hour prices at happy hour, we loved it! Valet parking is $27. but so are others.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: jattcf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with business peers, stayed here for two nights. We had booked our room through an online travel agency. Upon arrival, the desk clerk could not find our reservation. After 45 mins, at 12:30 at night, she had figured out that the travel agency never told them about our paid reservation. I felt bad for the poor girl because by now the valet, operations, and back office people were getting upset with her for not getting us checked-in more quickly and it wasn't really her fault, except for that she didn't really know what to do when she could not find our reservation. To make up for the long wait, she upgraded us to getting two connecting rooms, one a double and one corner king suite. The corner suite was huge, well appointed and beautiful with great views of downtown phx. As it is a new hotel, everything is in great shape and has a modern luxurious feel. It is also nicely located just a few blocks from many things, like the convention center, restaurants and parks. For around $$$ - go downtown to The Arrogant Butcher and try their cheese fondue with pretzels. I would fly back just to have those again!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Extroardinary”
Reviews.Author: traveladvisor1323
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed a hotel before in my life, But the Westin Hotel in Phoenix was so spectacular that I just had to do so. The staff is welcoming and highly competent, the rooms are spectacular, and there is an amazing restaurant on site. This is one of the finest hotels I have stayed in anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Growing pains at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumpelstilzkin
Reviews.Content: I read the five stellar reviews and have to disagree strongly with the glowing reviews of this hotel. Yes, it is new and with that come lots of problems. The worst is the air conditioning vent., It blows all the time, and you CANNOT turn it off. That's for supposedly green reasons. How can that be? The thing blows in every room 24/7. That's insane. So you have generally cold air blowing on your face all night long. Not fun. and doesn't exactly make for restful sleep. The restaurant is horrible. The food is well below average and quite expensive. We had breakfast and it was barely edible. The pool deck is closed and not slated for opening for several more months. The stairwell is locked from the inside, so if you get in, you can't get out anywhere but the bottom floor but there's no notice of that. They try to not make up the room or bring you towels unless you specifically ask for clean towels. On the good side, the staff is polite and generally helpful. They try hard to rectify the myriad problems, but ultimately there's only so much they can do. the gym is well maintained and the free bottled water is a nice touch. I think what was most disappointing is that the hotel looks really nice but below the surface there lay hidden a lot of problems and they really interfere with a pleasant stay. Wish I could have been more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in downtown Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: mjculbreth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Downtown last weekend. It was my first time but I'm sure I'll be back. The service eas great starting with the valet team. Check in was smooth and the rooms are amazing. My room was huge and had floor to ceiling windows with a great view of the city. Thank you Westin team for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: a0002140
Reviews.Content: The hotel just opened and I think that we were the first people in our room. The decor of the hotel is spectacular, the beds are really heavenly and the view was great. Westin really went out of their way to make this hotel special. The staff is new, but they worked hard to make our stay wonderful. My only complaint is that they could have had more light in the room, particularly the bathroom. Also parking is expensive at $27.00 per night. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Traveler724
Reviews.Content: This Westin just opened and it is clear the company took the time and money to do it right, including training an excellent staff. The rooms are spacious with nice views of the Valley of the Sun; flirts are named after the mines of the building's other tenant, Freeport-McMoRan. Room service and the restaurant, Province, are also top notch. This is a welcome addition to downtown Phoenix where the existing hotels are showing their age. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Addition to Downtown Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. With Westin, you generally expect a certain consistency with the experience and this is certainly true at this Westin. The bed, linens and bathroom amenities were all of high quality. But this Westin is a little different in some ways. It seems smaller and boutique-ish as opposed to huge and convention-ish. I liked that very much. The room was large--about 600 sq feet and was decorated in the dark wood that has been popular for a while now. It accommodated 2 queen beds, a desk area and a couch. The bathroom was up to snuff. It was quiet. There were floor to ceiling windows with valley views. Overall, very nice. The bar was nice. The staff was friendly and made good cocktails. It is a nice place to sit and unwind. The restaurant has a nice menu, but we didn't try the food. The staff in the lobby was very courteous and friendly. I question whether there are enough potential guests to fill the increasing number of hotel rooms downtown, but this may fill a niche for a smaller upscale place for business travelers or locals attending an event downtown to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best westin I have ever stayed at. Amazing business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kbatlanta
Reviews.Content: Loved this brand new westin. The room was huge, with a giant bathroom with stand alone shower. Decor was a nice update on the standard drab westin beige. The decor was very modern and sophisticated. Great club lounge and adequate work out facitility. Highly recommend it. Above average in all aspects

HotelInfo.Name: Westin Phoenix Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 333 North Central Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85004
